glosses: like, -like, -ly; -ish; as if, as though; in the way of

examples.text: Bence bu iyi bir fikir değil...
examples.translation: In my opinion, this isn't a good idea.

glosses: Used to form adverbs from nouns and adjectives.
-ish: Used to form glossonyms from demonyms or ethnonyms.

examples.text: İngiliz (“English”) + -ce → İngilizce (“English language”, literally “like an English person”)

glosses: -ian, -ese: Used to form glossonyms from the name of a country or region.

examples.text: Çin (“China”) + -ce → Çince (“Chinese language”, literally “in the way of China”)

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ـجه (-ce), ultimately from Proto-Turkic *-če (orientative–prolative suffix).
